posts._title: Luchino Visconti – La Caduta Degli Dei (Götterdämmerung) AKA The Damned [English dub] (1969)
posts.title: La Caduta Degli Dei (Götterdämmerung)
posts.excerpt: Quote:This brooding, operatic movie about Nazism makes Cabaret look like wholesome family fare. The family in The Damned is a symbol of German society circa 1934. The Krupp-like steel magnate Baron von Essenbeck represents the spineless establishment. The Nazis kill the baron, then frame one heir apparent, a socialist (married to the stunning Charlotte Rampling). …

posts.title: Munich
posts.excerpt: September 1972. A Palestinian commando called “Black September” takes hostage the Israeli delegation at the Munich Olympics. A forgotten détournement work by the video pioneer Carole Roussopoulos.

posts.title: Chunhyangdyun
posts.excerpt: Summary:Mongryong marries the beautiful Chunhyang without telling his father, the Governor of Namwon. When his father is transferred to Seoul, Mongryong has to leave Chunhyang and finish his exams. Chunhyang, being the daughter of a courtesan, is also legally a courtesan. She is beaten and imprisoned when she refuses to obey the new Governor Byun, …

posts._title: Sébastien Betbeder – 2 automnes 3 hivers AKA 2 Autumns, 3 Winters (2013)
posts.title: 2 automnes 3 hivers
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Arman is 33 and ready to make a change, starting with a run in the park. When he literally bumps into Amélie – slightly cynical but nevertheless lovely – on the jogging path, he’s dead-set on making a connection with her. As a bit of contrived fate brings them together, Arman’s best friend Benjamin suffers …

posts._title: Bahrudin ‘Bato’ Cengic – Gluvi barut AKA Silent Gunpowder (1990)
posts.title: Gluvi barut
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Based on a novel by Branko Copic and set during World War II, the film tells the story of a Serbian village in the mountains of Bosnia and its villagers who found themselves divided along two opposing ideological lines, represented by the Chetniks and the Partisans. These two opposing sides are personified in the Partisan …

posts._title: Luigi Magni – In nome del papa re AKA In the Name of the Pope King (1977)
posts.title: In nome del papa re
posts.excerpt: In 1867, with Garibaldi’s forces close to bringing Rome into the Italian kingdom, Monsignor Colombo da Priverno, a world-weary judge on the papal court, wants to resign, disgusted by the violence to which the papacy resorts to hold secular power. That night, three rebels blow up the Zouaves’ barracks. Colombo learns that a brief liaison …

posts._title: Harald Philipp – Blonde Köder für den Mörder AKA The Blonde Connection AKA Death Knocks Twice (1969)
posts.title: Blonde Köder für den Mörder
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:While looking for a stolen diamond necklace,the private investigator Bob Martin uncovers a smart serial killer. Review:DEATH KNOCKS TWICE is an excellent vehicle for both leading man Dean Reed (in this film he reminds me of a cross between James Franciscus, Tab Hunter, and the pre-burnout Jan-Michael Vincent), who plays a detective out to solve …
posts.titleEnglish: The Blonde Connection AKA Death Knocks Twice

posts._title: Hussein Kamal – Thartharah fawq al-Nil AKA Adrift on the Nile (1971)
posts.title: Thartharah fawq al-Nil
posts.excerpt: Set against the backdrop of the 1967 Six-Day War, the movie adaptation of Naguib Mahfouz’s novel follows the escapist, drug-fuelled riverboat meetings of a group of frustrated Egyptians from various walks of life.

posts._title: Mihalis Kakogiannis – Alexis Zorbas AKA Zorba the Greek [+Commentary] (1964)
posts.title: Alexis Zorbas
posts.excerpt: If ever there was a role that Anthony Quinn was born to play, it was the lusty, life-affirming title character in Zorba the Greek. The scene is the isle of Crete, where English writer Alan Bates arrives in the hopes of realigning his own values and outlook on life. He is “adopted” by the flamboyant …

posts._title: David Leaf & John Scheinfeld – The Unknown Marx Brothers (1993)
posts.title: The Unknown Marx Brothers
posts.excerpt: Leslie Nielsen hosts this retrospective of the Marx Brothers, from their early career on stage to their post-film career in television. Their children and co-workers are interviewed, and numerous clips and rare footage being shown.
